servinfo.title: DTC P0190: Fuel Rail Pressure Sensor Circuit Malfunction

item.ptxt: Conditions for applying the fault finding procedure to stored faults:
The fault is declared present after repeated engine starts or with the engine running.
Use service wire for all operations on the controller connectors.
If the fault is present:
The engine will stop immediately.
It is impossible to restart.
The Red stop warning light (gravity 2 warning light) is lit.
Priorities when dealing with a number of faults:
As a priority, deal with fault DTC P0697: Sensor Reference Voltage “C” Circuit / Open Malfunction if the fault is present or stored.

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: For wiring circuit and connector number, refer to A-5 Engine and A/C Control System Circuit Diagram (DSL) .

entry.ptxt: Short circuit to vehicle body ground
Open circuit or short circuit to +12 V

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CC.0: Short circuit to vehicle body ground

entry.ptxt: Check the fuel pressure sensor connectors.
Check the continuity and insulation from vehicle body ground of the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “C84-2” wire of fuel pressure sensor connector and “C86-32” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C84-3” wire of fuel pressure sensor connector and “C86-48” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault is still present, replace the fuel pressure sensor with common rail referring to Common Rail (High Pressure Fuel Injection Rail) Removal and Installation .

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CO.1: Open circuit or short circuit to +12 V

entry.ptxt: Check the fuel pressure sensor connectors.
Check for continuity and insulation from the +12 V feed on the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “C84-2” wire of fuel pressure sensor connector and “C86-32” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C84-1” wire of fuel pressure sensor connector and “C86-46” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C84-3” wire of fuel pressure sensor connector and “C86-48” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault is still present, replace the fuel pressure sensor with common rail referring to Common Rail (High Pressure Fuel Injection Rail) Removal and Installation .

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for 1.DEF: Offset at minimum threshold

entry.ptxt: Check the fuel pressure sensor connectors.
Check the following connections for continuity and make sure there is no interference resistance:

item.ptxt: Between “C84-2” wire of fuel pressure sensor connector and “C86-32” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C84-3” wire of fuel pressure sensor connector and “C86-48” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C84-1” wire of fuel pressure sensor connector and “C86-46” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: With ignition switch ON and the engine stationary for more than one minute:

item.ptxt: Check for fuel pressure sensor output voltage between “C84-2” and “C84-1” wire of fuel pressure sensor connector.
If the voltage is above 0.5V, the sensor is in order.
In this case, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
If the voltage is below 0.5V, replace the fuel pressure sensor with common rail referring to Common Rail (High Pressure Fuel Injection Rail) Removal and Installation .
